Requirement: A melee weapon with the Two-Handed trait.

Both hands on your weapon, you rest it on your shoulder. You widen your stance to support full-body swings, tightening your grip in anticipation.

Pros

Cleave

  • Once per turn, during your attack action, you can target two creatures with a single attack so long as they are both:
    • Within reach of you.
    • Within 10ft of each other.
Called Shot
  • You take an action to prepare a strike, ending your turn. At the beginning of your next turn, you can choose to attack a target within range. This attack takes up an action, but automatically hits and is a critical hit. You can take a desperate action to trigger the called shot critical hit early, but you gain a level of @Compendium[undertaking.conditions.ERBR3AG01H4N1L91]{Exhaustion} and cannot take a desperate action until after your next full turn. If you otherwise take an action or a desperate action before this, your strike is no longer prepared.
Fulcrum-Free
  • You can make attacks with two-handed weapons using one hand, but the attack is made at disadvantage.

Cons

Full Swing

  • Attack actions take up both your action and minor action.
Grasp-Free
  • If you roll a critical fail on a Fulcrum-Free attack, you drop your weapon and exit this stance.
